Class BasicCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ub.prog2.utils.BasicCtrl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class BasicCtrl
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Basic controller that implements basic operations.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimer

        public void setTimer(int milisecs)
        Defines the timer interval. The timer remains stopped until the start method is invoqued.
        Parameters:
        milisecs - interval of time between events (in milliseconds)
        See Also:
        startTimer(), stopTimer(), onTimer()

      • onTimer

        protected void onTimer()
        Event launched by the timer.

      • onKeyTyped

        protected void onKeyTyped(int keyCode)
        Event launched by pressing a key
        Parameters:
        keyCode - ASCII code for pressed key

      • onMouseClicked

        protected void onMouseClicked(int button,
                  int clickCount)
        Event launched by pressing mouse buttons
        Parameters:
        button - Identifier for pressed button
        clickCount - Allows to diferentiate between single click or double click

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
                throws VisorException
        Start the timer object.
        Throws:
        VisorException - if no timer is previously defined or it has already been started
        See Also:
        setTimer(int)

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
               throws VisorException
        Stop the timer object.
        Throws:
        VisorException - if no timer is previously defined or is not started
        See Also:
        setTimer(int)

      • destroyTimer

        public void destroyTimer()
                  throws VisorException
        Destroy the timer object.
        Throws:
        VisorException - if no timer is previously defined
        See Also:
        setTimer(int)
